Decreases reload time by 0.5 seconds.

Solvent Jug.description:
A volatile chemical compound that irritates the respiratory tract, but increases absorption of The Afterpiece Antidote.

Increases duration of Invigoration by 1 seconds.

Kerosene Can.description:
A thin and clear combustible liquid which numbs the mind when inhaled.

Intoxication inflicts Blindness for 30 seconds.

Blindness prevents Survivors from seeing auras.

Sticky Soda Bottle.description:
An empty bottle, sticky with dried sugar and blood.

Start with 1 extra bottle. Increases maximum carried bottles amount by 1.

Starling Feather.description:
A black feather with an emerald sheen, very soft to the touch.

Decreases bottle throw cooldown by 50%.

Spirit of Hartshorn.description:
A pungent chemical compound consisting of ammonia. One whiff is enough to jolt even the most sluggish of minds.

Increases the size and spread of Afterpiece Antidote gas clouds by 20%.

Sulphuric Acid Vial.description:
An odorless syrupy liquid which is highly corrosive.

Intoxication inflicts Mangled.

Mangled increases time required to heal by 25% and lasts until fully healed.

Flask of Bleach.description:
A potent chemical which causes irritation, burn and lungs damage.

Increases the Hindered penalty from Intoxication by an additional 4%.

Hindered reduces Survivor movement speed.

Bottle of Chloroform.description:
A sweet-smelling organic compound with strong anesthetic capabilities.

Increases the size and spread of Afterpiece Tonic gas clouds by 20%.

Garish Make-up Kit.description:
Some for the face and some for the Antidote. The unknown compound intensifies the Antidote's effects.

Increases the duration of Invigoration by 2 seconds.

Cheap Gin Bottle.description:
Along with a hell of a headache, the only remnant of a good time, done cheap.

Start with 2 extra bottles. Increases maximum carried bottles amount by 2.

Ether 15 Vol%.description:
A highly volatile organic compound, toxic at this concentration.

Increases the duration of Intoxication by 1 second.

Cigar Box.description:
A grim and incomplete collection of fingers. Fills The Clown with longing and focuses his chemical crafting abilities.

While The Clown or a Survivor is Invigorated, they see all other Survivor and Killer auras within 16 meters.

Tattoo's Middle Finger.description:
The prized middle finger of a large tattooed man. Has a faint taste of machinery oil.

Auras of Intoxicated or Invigorated Survivors are revealed to you for 6 seconds.

Redhead's Pinky Finger.description:
The prized pinky of a redhead. Faintly fragrant. Tastes of potpourri and varnish.

Direct hits by a bottle of Afterpiece Tonic inflict Exposed until Intoxication ends.Start with 2 fewer bottles. Decreases maximum carried bottles amount by 2.

Exposed Survivors will be downed by basic attacks even if uninjured.

Cheap Cologne.description:
Dollar store cologne with a pungent scent of rubbing alcohol. Worn by Ghost Face to make his presence known. Reserved for impromptu visits.

Increases Marked duration by 10 seconds.

Chewed Pen.description:
Blue pen with a chewed cap that holds traces of Danny’s DNA. Incriminating evidence that was never found.

Survivors that are in the dying state take 3 seconds to reveal The Ghost Face.

Driver's License.description:
A driver’s license revealing Olsen’s true identity: Danny Johnson.

When Marking a Survivor repairing a generator, the generator explodes and loses 20% progress.The affected generator becomes blocked for 15 seconds.When Marking multiple Survivors at the same time, the loss of progress only applies once.

Drop-Leg Knife Sheath.description:
Sheath allowing a full motion range: ideal to inflict quick and powerful wounds while moving freely. Stolen from a patrol officer the night Danny left Philadelphia.

The Ghost Face gains 10% movement speed for 5 seconds after Marking a Survivor.

Headline Cutouts.description:
Cutouts of articles covering unsolved murder cases from Utah to Pennsylvania. While Ghost Face only authored some of the headlines, he committed all the murders.

Compiling your success makes you proud and boosts your confidence.

Increases movement speed while stalking by 40%.

Knife Belt Clip.description:
Perfect belt clip to scout carry your blade discreetly. No one knows what you’re planning to do tonight.

Reduces the Terror Radius by 8 meters while crouching.

Lasting Perfume.description:
An overpowering musky fragrance worn by Ghost Face to announce his presence. Reserved for victims he planned to write about.

Survivors that are on a hook take 3 seconds to reveal The Ghost Face.

Leather Knife Sheath.description:
Quiet and flexible sheath to carry your blade. Movement is easier when things are fastened into place.

Increases crouched movement speed by 10%.

Marked Map.description:
The annotated map of Northern Roseville, Florida. Each X represents a victim of The Ghost Face. Mapping out your targets allows you to roam the streets undetected.

Increases duration of Killer Instinct after being revealed by 2 seconds.

Night Vision Monocular.description:
Night vision lens enabling sharp photos even when shrouded in darkness. Ideal for discreet, impromptu visits late at night.

A Survivor that reveals The Ghost Face is inflicted with Exhausted for 5 seconds.

Exhausted prevents Survivors from activating exhausting perks.

Olsen's Address Book.description:
Filled in blunt, blue crabbed writing. All the Roseville murder victims are listed there, along with their phone number and address.

Survivors that are Marked reveal their auras for 5 seconds when performing rushed actions.

Olsen's Journal.description:
A spiral notebook filled with stained, handwritten entries. The journal details different equipment used to stalk victims.

A Survivor that is Marked is inflicted with Oblivious until the Mark expires.

Oblivious prevents Survivors from hearing or being affected by the Killer's Terror Radius.

Olsen's Wallet.description:
Olsen’s wallet holds thirty dollars in cash, a video club membership card, and a folded picture of Olsen’s first Roseville victim. Carrying incriminating evidence boosts your excitement and resolve.

Breaking a pallet or wall immediately recharges Night Shroud.

Outdoor Security Camera.description:
A small surveillance camera that filmed Ghost Face breaking into a house on Belleview Road in Northern Roseville. The camera was positioned at the perfect angle to catch a glimpse of Ghost Face without providing any real clues to the police.

The auras of all Survivors are revealed for 7 seconds when a Marked Survivor is put into the dying state.

\"Philly\".description:
Stolen camera from a victim of Olsen’s in Philadelphia, where he worked before. The film inside captured his last night in the city.

Decreases time required to Mark a Survivor by 20%.

Cinch Straps.description:
Black straps that keep everything in place while on the prowl.

Night Shroud remains active after a failed basic attack.

Telephoto Lens.description:
A manual focus lens to take pictures from afar without being noticed.

A Survivor that reveals The Ghost Face is inflicted with Oblivious for 60 seconds.

Oblivious prevents Survivors from hearing or being affected by the Killer's Terror Radius.

\"Ghost Face Caught on Tape\".description:
Tape obtained by Olsen to write an article that terrorized Roseville.

Instantly recharges Night Shroud after a successful basic attack that puts a Survivor into the dying state.

Victim's Detailed Routine.description:
A ripped page outlining the weekly routine of Olsen's first victim in Roseville. Compiling your victim's habits allows you to anticipate and counter their next move.

After being Marked, Survivors are inflicted with Exhausted for 5 seconds.

Exhausted prevents Survivors from activating exhausting perks.

Walleye's Matchbook.description:
A sheet of matches from Walleye's, a small bar in Northern Roseville. A victim’s phone number is scribbled in blue. One of the incriminating pieces of evidence found.

Decreases Night Shroud recovery time by 6 seconds.

Barbed Wire.description:
Pliable American made steel lined with sharp barbs. Despite its simplicity, Caleb found it could be wrapped around a spear to increase its viciousness.

Increases Survivor mend time by 3.5 seconds.

Bayshore's Cigar.description:
A quality cigar, plucked from the jacket of Caleb’s boss while he wailed over the spear lodged in his abdomen.

Decreases the stun duration when Survivors break free by 1 second.

Bayshore's Gold Tooth.description:
A golden tooth torn from Henry Bayshore as he screamed for mercy, hours before he was finished off.

Increases The Redeemer's reeling speed by 9%.

Chewing Tobacco.description:
A can of clipped and sweetened tobacco leaves lifted from a gutted body in Glenvale. Stimulates the nervous system.

Decreases the stun duration when Survivors break free by 0.5 seconds.

Gold Creek Whiskey.description:
Warm comfort in a bottle that quelled Caleb’s anger and slowed his step.

Decreases Terror Radius by 8 meters while aiming down The Redeemer's sights.

Hellshire Iron.description:
The Hellshire Gang’s branding iron. Despite folklore, it never made its mark on new initiates, instead having been used to brand particularly quarrelsome bounties.

When a Survivor is speared, gain Undetectable. The effect persists for 10 seconds after the Survivor is no longer speared.

Undetectable hides the Killer's aura, Terror Radius and Red Stain.

Honey Locust Thorn.description:
Angered with a bounty who fled twice before, Caleb twisted thorn branches onto a spear and let it loose.

Breaking free from the spear inflicts Mangled.

Mangled increases time required to heal by 25% and lasts until fully healed.

Iridescent Coin.description:
A glass-like coin molded from The Fog itself. Payment to the bounty hunter for services rendered.

Survivors speared from at least 12 meters away are inflicted with Exposed for as long as they remain speared.

Exposed survivors will be downed by basic attacks even if uninjured.

Jaw Smasher.description:
The bullet that ripped through Caleb’s jaw during a frenzied shootout. It brings back a burning desire for revenge.

Increases movement speed by 1% while aiming down The Redeemer's sights.

Marshal's Badge.description:
A silver badge taken from the corpse of a lawman in Arizona Territory who interfered with the Hellshire Gang’s bounties.

Decreases Terror Radius by 4 meters while aiming down The Redeemer's sights.

Modified Ammo Belt.description:
An old ammo belt Caleb altered for his specialized weaponry. Still holds the fine red dirt of the Arizona Territory desert.

Decreases The Redeemer's reload time by 0.25 seconds.

Poison Oak Leaves.description:
An ordinary looking plant, Caleb found that spears coated in its oil caused unbearable blistering around wounds.

Increases Survivor mend time by 1.5 seconds.

Prison Chain.description:
A thick, heavy chain that once held a steel ball and latched to Caleb’s ankle. It’s been repurposed to hook onto a spear.

Increases time required for a Survivor to break free from a spear by 10%.

Rickety Chain.description:
Weak steel links first used on Caleb's prototype Speargun. Despite the chain's failings, it holds sentimental value.

Grants 50% bonus Bloodpoints for Speared score events.Survivors break free 33% faster.

Rusted Spike.description:
A railroad spike that Caleb fastened to the front of the Speargun during a moment of morbid curiosity. The dull tip prevents it from cleanly piercing its target.

The Redeemer's shots inflict Mangled.

Mangled increases time required to heal by 25% and lasts until fully healed.

Snake Oil.description:
A tincture of oils and extracts purchased from a travelling salesman. Purported to cure all that ails you.

Increases The Redeemer's reeling speed by 5%.

Spit Polish Rag.description:
A grimy piece of burlap. Spit and elbow grease was enough to wipe down the speargun in the heat of a shootout.

Decreases The Redeemer's miss cooldown by 0.25 seconds.

Tin Oil Can.description:
A can holding a small amount of oil to reduce friction in machinery. Early models of the Speargun were notorious for jamming, and oil had to be readily available.

Decreases The Redeemer's miss cooldown by 0.5 seconds.

Wanted Poster.description:
The yellowed remains of a wanted poster for Mason Kelly. Kept Caleb focused on the hunt.

Increases movement speed by 2.5% while aiming down The Redeemer's sights.

Warden's Keys.description:
The dull jangle of the keys evokes a furious memory within Caleb.

Decreases The Redeemer's reload time by 0.5 seconds.

Amanita Toxin.description:
A toxin applied to the Hatchets' blade. The Amanita mushrooms' toxin numbs the mind.

Hatchets inflict Blindness for 60 seconds.

Blindness prevents Survivors from seeing auras.

Bandaged Haft.description:
First-aid bandages securely rolled and attached to the Hatchets' haft.

Decreases Hatchet throw cooldown by 10%.

Begrimed Head.description:
These Hatchets' heads are stained with a foul substance that afflict anyone it touches with debilities.

Hit target suffers from the Mangled and Hemorrhage status effects until fully healed.

Hemorrhage regresses healing progress when not healing, and increases blood trails left by injured survivors.

Mangled increases time required to heal by 25% and lasts until fully healed.

Yellowed Cloth.description:
A simple scrap of material to tend to blisters and wipe the puss away.

Increases thrown hatchet speed by 10%.

Coarse Stone.description:
This stone is too coarse to do any good. A blade damaged by it inflicts awful open wounds.

Hitting a target increases the volume of their grunts of pain by 50% until healed.

Deerskin Gloves.description:
Cured leather gloves that protect the hands and give a sure grip.

Decreases time required to reload Hatchets at a locker by 20%.

Weighted Head.description:
An oddly weighted hatchet head, crafted to deliver a hard blow to its target. It requires a wielder with a strong arm.

Hatchets inflict Incapacitated for 10 seconds.

Incapacitated prevents Survivors from healing, repairing, sabotaging, cleansing, blessing, mending, or using items.

Flower Babushka.description:
A clean and colorful kerchief adorned with a flower pattern. This memory of a lost little one fills the Huntress with rage and focus.

Decreases time required to wind up a Hatchet throw by 12%.

Glowing Concoction.description:
An otherworldly concoction that faintly glows a foreboding light.

Reveals the auras of Survivors hit by Hatchets for 5 seconds.

Infantry Belt.description:
A sturdy utility belt pillaged from a soldier. Its multiple leather loops and holsters are useful to transport tools.

Start with 2 extra Hatchets.Increases maximum carried Hatchet amount by 2.

Iridescent Head.description:
A glass-like Hatchet head molded from The Fog Itself. The blade is warm and reverberating with The Entity's power.

Successful Hatchet hits immediately put healthy Survivors into the dying state.Sets maximum number of carried Hatchets to 1.

Leather Loop.description:
This leather strip tied into a loop can be attached to a belt to allow easy transportation of tools.

Start with 1 extra Hatchet.Increases maximum carried Hatchet amount by 1.

Manna Grass Braid.description:
A circular decorative braid made from manna grass. This memory of a lost little one fills the Huntress with rage and focus.

Decreases time required to wind up a Hatchet throw by 8%.

Oak Haft.description:
A polished haft which allows for a quick and sly manipulation of the deadly tool.

Decreases Hatchet throw cooldown by 20%.

Soldier's Puttee.description:
A wrap taken from a dead soldier, it provides protection and support to the ankle and lower leg.

The Huntress moves 4.6 m/s when she has no Hatchets.

Rusty Head.description:
These Hatchets' heads are covered with crusty and volatile rust spots that makes injuries particularly difficult to heal.

Hatchets inflict Mangled.

Mangled increases time required to heal by 25% and lasts until fully healed.

Shiny Pin.description:
A copper pin defaced beyond recognition yet polished to a high sheen. Pillaged from a particularly difficult prey.

Increases The Huntress' movement speed by 5% while aiming or throwing a Hatchet.

Venomous Concoction.description:
A toxic concoction applied to the Hatchets' blade. The murky concoction is mainly composed of Berus snake venom which gives it fatiguing capabilities.

Hatchets inflict Exhausted for 5 seconds.

Exhausted prevents Survivors from activating exhausting perks.

Wooden Fox.description:
Roughly carved, this fox statuette is no more than a few inches. A reminder that stealth and cunning is as effective as raw power.

Grants Undetectable for 30 seconds after reloading.

Undetectable hides the Killer's aura, Terror Radius, and Red Stain.

Rose Root.description:
Dried petals that relieve symptoms of fatigue and overexertion when brewed in a tea.

Increases thrown Hatchet speed by 20%.

Iridescent Brick.description:
Once representative of Max Jr’s confinement, this was the first brick to fall when his room’s barricade came crashing down.

After maintaining a Chainsaw Sprint for 2 seconds, grants Undetectable until the Chainsaw Sprint ends.

Undetectable hides the Killer's aura, Terror Radius, and Red Stain.

Cat Figurine.description:
A wooden figure that had caught young Victor's eye. He shrieked until his mother stole it from the market, nearly blowing their cover.

Displays the target location of a Pounce.

Rusted Needle.description:
A needle Madeleine used to sew up her children’s tattered clothes.

Crushing Victor when attached inflicts Hemorrhage until healed.

Hemorrhage regresses healing progress when not healing, and increases blood trails left by injured survivors.

Sewer Sludge.description:
A disgusting, sticky mixture that covered the Deshayes during an escape attempt through the city sewers.

Increases time to crush Victor when attached by 2 seconds.

Madeleine's Scarf.description:
A cloth Madeleine wore shortly before her death. The Twins kept it as a memento.

Increases Victor's movement speed by 0.3 m/s.

Stale Biscuit.description:
A hard, unleavened biscuit that Madeleine stole from a town’s market. It wasn’t much, but it was better than most meals.

Decreases Pounce cooldown by 0.4 seconds.

Weighty Rattle.description:
A shoddily carved rattle that Victor cried over until his mother stole it for him. It’s entirely too heavy to be trusted to a child.

Crushing Victor when attached inflicts Broken for 20 seconds.

Broken prevents Survivors from being healed.

Forest Stew.description:
A stew of foraged vegetables mixed with moss and bark to create a false sense of fullness.

Increases Victor's movement speed by 0.6 m/s.

Spinning Top.description:
A wooden top shared between The Twins, though Victor wanted it for his own. He learned he could get what he wanted if he clung tightly and screamed.

Victor's Pounce causes Survivors to drop their carried items.

Drop of Perfume.description:
One of the few luxuries Madeleine escaped her past life with. It has a pleasant, disarming scent.

Survivors in Victor's alert range while he is dormant are inflicted with Oblivious.

Oblivious prevents Survivors from hearing or being affected by the Killer's Terror Radius.

Victor's Soldier.description:
A toy soldier Victor clung to when scared. Something about it evoked jealousy in Charlotte.

Crushing Victor while he is dormant reveals the Survivor's aura for 6 seconds.

Silencing Cloth.description:
A coarse strip of cloth that a five-year-old Charlotte would put in her mouth. Stopped her from screaming when witch hunters were nearby.

Charlotte gains Undetectable for 20 seconds after waking from her dormant state.

Undetectable hides the Killer's aura, Terror Radius, and Red Stain.

Tiny Fingernail.description:
Charlotte had many ways to mourn Victor’s death. As the fingernails loosened from his rotting hands, she took one in remembrance.

Decreases Victor's Unbind time by 0.5 seconds.

Iridescent Pendant.description:
A glass-like pendant molded from The Fog itself. There’s a portrait of Madeleine Deshayes upon it, though something about her depiction seems unsettling.

Crushing Victor while he is dormant inflicts Exposed for 45 seconds.

Exposed Survivors will be downed by basic attacks even if uninjured.

Soured Milk.description:
A metal bottle filled with milk that has since soured. Loud as Victor could be, he quieted down when presented with his meal.

Increases Victor's alert range by 2 meters.

Toy Sword.description:
A miniscule toy sword, only a few inches long. Holding it brought out a violent enthusiasm in Victor.

Decreases Pounce charge time by 0.2 seconds.

Cat's Eye.description:
An eyeball that belonged to a cat eaten by the starving Deshayes’ family. Victor hid it from his mother, using it as a toy.

Victor becomes silent while Pounce is fully charged.

Madeleine's Glove.description:
A glove once owned by The Twins’ mother. During desperate times, it was held over Victor’s mouth to keep him from making a peep.

Increases Victor's alert range by 4 meters.

Bloody Black Hood.description:
A hood from one of the men that hunted Charlotte. Soon, he became the prey.

Decreases Charlotte's waking time by 0.5 seconds.

Ceremonial Candelabrum.description:
The candelabrum that Victor tipped over, causing his captors to burn. A symbol of his tenacity.

Increases time to crush Victor when he is dormant by 0.2 seconds.

Baby Teeth.description:
Two teeth that Victor lost long ago. They’re unusually sharp.

Crushing Victor when attached inflicts Blindness for 30 seconds.

Blindness prevents Survivors from seeing auras.

Damaged Syringe.description: Medical equipment that fared poorly during the chaos that overwhelmed Raccoon City.Increases time it takes Survivors to use a Vaccine by 2 seconds.Increases length of Killer Instinct when Survivors use a Vaccine by 1.5 seconds.

Tyrant Gore.description: A damaged sample from a T-002 Tyrant that died in combat. There are signs of severe burns.Increases mutation rate when destroying zombies with Tentacle Strike by 50%.Decreases zombie respawn time by 5 seconds.

Serotonin Injector.description:
A hormone that slightly relaxes the user for when stealth is required.Grants Undetectable for 15 seconds when a zombie is destroyed.

Undetectable hides the Killer's aura, Terror Radius, and Red Stain.

T-Virus Sample.description: A sample of the T-Virus developed by Umbrella Corporation, it causes extreme mutations and brain damage in its subjects.Increases mutation rate when destroying zombies with Tentacle Strike by 100%.

Plant 43 Vines.description: The tangled remnants of a plant infected with the T-Virus, it killed one of the researchers who developed it.Increases time required for Survivors to open Supply Cases by 4 seconds.

Licker Tongue.description:
A sticky prehensile tongue that easily wraps around anything it touches.Survivors are Hindered for an extra 0.2 seconds after being Contaminated.

Hindered reduces Survivor movement speed.

NE-α Parasite.description:
A parasite used in the development of Nemesis T-Types, it’s capable of hijacking its host’s brain.Becoming Contaminated inflicts Oblivious for 60 seconds, or until the Survivor receives a Vaccine.

Oblivious prevents Survivors from hearing or being affected by the Killer's Terror Radius.

Jill's Sandwich.description: It’s tragically squished and dripping with blood from a recent battle. Despite that, it has a delicious aroma that can’t be missed.Reveals a Survivor's aura for 12 seconds after they unlock a Supply Case.

Broken Recovery Coin.description: A coin depicting a bird framed by a laurel wreath. It’s broken in half.Removes 1 Supply Case from the trial.

Depleted Ink Ribbon.description: Who will save them now? There’s something about this ink ribbon being dry that energizes zombies.Decreases zombie respawn time by 5 seconds.Increases zombie movement speed by 50%.Any zombies destroyed after all generators are repaired will respawn in an exit area.

Shattered S.T.A.R.S. Badge.description: A symbol of hope for Raccoon City, utterly destroyed.Increases Zombie movement speed by 150% for 60 seconds after a generator is repaired.

Brian's Intestine.description: The small intestine of Brian Irons, chief of the RPD. It's an appetizing sight for zombies.Increases zombie movement speed by 25%.

Iridescent Umbrella Badge.description:
A glass-like badge molded from The Fog itself. It represents a corporation that pushed far beyond ethical and humane science.Survivors are inflicted with Exposed for 60 seconds when using a Vaccine.

Exposed Survivors will be downed by basic attacks even if uninjured.

Visitor Wristband.description: An electronic Umbrella wristband for visitors to the facility. It also doubles as a tracking device.Increases zombie detection range by 2 meters and field of view by 10 degrees.

S.T.A.R.S. Field Combat Manual.description: A manual of compiled S.T.A.R.S. close-range combat knowledge. Edited by Chris Redfield.Zombies’ auras turn yellow for 6 seconds after hitting a Survivor.

Marvin's Blood.description: The contaminated blood of a Raccoon City police officer.Increases mutation rate when hitting Survivors with Tentacle Strike by 25%.

Adrenaline Injector.description: A hormone that heightens senses and prepares the body to fight.Increases length of Killer Instinct when Survivors use a Vaccine by 3 seconds.

Mikhail's Eye.description: While little was left of Mikhail, his left eyeball survived the blast that killed him. It remains a tasty treat for zombies.Increases zombie movement speed by 35%.

Zombie Heart.description: The heart of an eviscerated zombie. It’s considered hazardous waste as it’s certainly teeming with viruses.Increases mutation rate when destroying zombies with Tentacle Strike by 50%.

Admin Wristband.description: An electronic Umbrella wristband for administrators of the facility. While allowing access to secure areas, it also doubles as a tracking device.Increases zombie detection range by 4 meters and field of view by 18 degrees.

Larry's Blood.description:
The blood of Larry Cotton, which partially resurrected his brother Frank.

Increases the possessed chain's maximum travel distance by 4 meters.

Bent Nail.description:
A simple nail that cut deep into Larry Cotton’s hand. Though the damage was superficial, it set into motion a horrifying set of events.

Gain 100% bonus Bloodpoints when binding a Survivor with a possessed chain.When hitting a Survivor with a possessed chain, only 1 additional chain will spawn.

Lively Crickets.description:
Insects which scarcely avoided being eaten by a mysterious drifter.

Increases turn rate of possessed chains by 10%.

Burning Candle.description:
A candle lit by Frank Cotton during a fatal summoning ceremony.

Decreases the time for Chain Hunts to activate by 3 seconds.

Leather Strip.description:
Leather strips torn from a cenobite’s uniform, allowing for the mutilation of exposed flesh.

Decreases Summons of Pain’s cooldown time after possessing a chain by 3%.

Wriggling Maggots.description:
Larvae that poured from the mouth of a corpse hidden in the Cotton household.

Increases turn rate of possessed chains by 15%.

Spoiled Meal.description:
A pile of mold, feasted on by a cockroach. Perhaps a sign of Frank Cotton’s mysterious disappearance...

Increases the possessed chain’s maximum travel distance by 2 meters.

Skewered Rat.description:
A crude solution for the Cotton home’s rat problem.

Decreases Summons of Pain’s cooldown time after possessing a chain by 9%.

Flickering Television.description:
A television that acted strangely upon the arrival of the cenobites.

Increases the maximum casting range of the gateway by 4 meters.

Liquified Gore.description:
The result of summoning the cenobites. There’s no telling what part of the human body this belonged to.

Increases the time it takes Survivors to solve the Lament Configuration by 1 second.

Torture Pillar.description:
A dangling slab covered in the gore of past victims.

Decreases the time for Chain Hunts to activate by 6 seconds.

Frank's Heart.description:
The beating heart of Frank, given life from his brother’s blood.

Increases the maximum casting range of the gateway by 8 meters.

Larry's Remains.description:
The skeletal remains of Larry Cotton, covered in a thick, sticky layer of blood.

Increases the time it takes Survivors to solve the Lament Configuration by 2 seconds.

Slice of Frank.description:
A slab of Frank’s face after his torture at the hand of the cenobites.

Survivors carrying the Lament Configuration are inflicted with Exhausted.

Exhausted prevents Survivors from activating exhausting perks.

Greasy Black Lens.description:
A lens from the sunglasses of an obese cenobite whose fleshy rolls droop down his face and neck.

Survivors hit by a possessed chain are revealed for 6 seconds.

Impaling Wire.description:
A wire that pierces the cheeks of a cenobite, while revealing the gaping wound on her neck.

When a Survivor uses the environment to break a chain, an additional chain will target them.

Chatterer's Tooth.description:
A fragment from a cenobite whose mouth chatters endlessly. This tooth, having broken from his jaw, is finally silent.

Reveal the Lament Configuration.Picking up the Lament Configuration deactivates Chain Hunts.Gain the Undetectable status effect for 25 seconds after picking up the Lament Configuration.

Undetectable hides the Killer's aura, Terror Radius and Red Stain.

Engineer's Fang.description:
A sharp tooth from the maw of a fleshy, scorpion-like creature, known to accompany cenobites on their grim undertakings.

Possessed chains injure healthy Survivors, but do not bind them or spawn additional chains.Increases the time to close the gateway after hitting a healthy Survivor with a possessed chain by 50%.When hitting an injured Survivor with a possessed chain, only 1 additional chain will spawn.

Iridescent Lament Configuration.description:
A glass-like puzzle box molded from The Fog itself. This replica differs from the original, providing altogether new powers.

When a Chain Hunt is inactive, Survivors beyond 24 meters of the Lament Configuration cannot see its aura.

Charcoal Stick.description:
A stick of charcoal that conceals anything it rubs over.

The Dire Crow's aura is no longer visible when in flight.The Dire Crow's aura is visible for 0.5 seconds when summoned.

Oil Paints.description:
There's little left but a few globs of black and gray, yet Carmina could paint an expansive landscape with them.

Increases the Dire Crow's Killer Instinct detection range by 1.5 meters.

Killer Instinct intermittently reveals the location of Survivors.

Vibrant Obituary.description:
Scrap newspaper, speckled with bright, eye-catching paint. It seems tragedy is a daily thing.

Increases the length of time a Dire Crow's Killer Instinct reveals Survivors by 1.5 seconds.

Killer Instinct intermittently reveals the location of Survivors.

Thick Tar.description:
Sticky, viscous sludge that Carmina used for an experimental piece. Once it sticks to skin, it's nearly impossible to get off.

Increases the time for Survivors to repel a Dire Crow swarm by 0.5 seconds.

Choclo Corn.description:
A type of corn common in South America. A few kernels are reason enough for a crow to stop for a snack.

Increases the time Dire Crows stay idle for before disintegrating by 2 seconds.

Automatic Drawing.description:
An experimental drawing Carmina made without conscious planning. Do not think—act.

Decreases Birds of Torment cooldown time by 1.5 seconds after a Dire Crow disintegrates from inactivity.

Festering Carrion.description:
A stomach-churning pile of meat and guts, yet it attracts hungry crows craving a bite.

Decreases Birds of Torment cooldown time by 0.5 seconds after a Dire Crow takes flight.

Velvet Fabric.description:
A striking red fabric Carmina used on an art project. Its brightness contrasted against black feathers.

When a Survivor attempts to repel a Dire Crow swarm, the swarm's aura remains visible for an additional 1.5 seconds.

Still Life Crow.description:
An ink drawing of a dead crow. Carmina's sadness over its death can be felt with each dark line.

Increases the time Dire Crows stay idle before disintegrating by 4 seconds.

Untitled Agony.description:
A canvas that was targeted with swipes and thrashes of black paint following Matias' death. It radiates with heavy, crippling sorrow.When Dire Crows swarm a Survivor, it afflicts them with the Hindered status effect for 1.5 seconds.

Hindered reduces Survivor movement speed.

Darkest Ink.description:
An unnatural ink, so wretched and dark that it seems to pull in light around it.

When Dire Crows swarm a Survivor, it afflicts them with the Blindness status effect. The effect persists for 15 seconds after Dire Crows are repelled from a Survivor.

Blindness prevents survivors from seeing auras.

O Grief, O Lover.description:
An abstract ink drawing that Carmina drew before walking to the Death Leap.

When Dire Crows swarm a Survivor, it afflicts them with the Exhausted status effect.

Exhausted prevents Survivors from activating certain perks.

Thorny Nest.description:
A nest that remained empty near Carmina's home. There are sharp thorns embedded in it.

Survivors damaged by a Dire Crow are afflicted with the Hemorrhage and Mangled status effects.

Hemorrhage regresses healing progress when not healing, and increases blood trails left by injured Survivors.

Mangled increases time required to heal by 25% and lasts until fully healed.

Silver Bell.description:
A shiny trinket that a crow took a liking to. The clinking of the bell was a distraction to all but Carmina.

When Dire Crows swarm a Survivor it afflicts them with the Oblivious status effect.

Oblivious prevents Survivors from hearing and being affected by the Killer's Terror Radius.

Matias' Baby Shoes.description:
A grieving reminder to Carmina that Matias would be with her, always watching.

Survivors within 5 meters of an idle Dire Crow have their auras revealed for 3 seconds.

Severed Tongue.description:
Carmina's tongue, cut from her mouth shortly before her death. The sight instills rage not just in her, but in her crows.

Decreases the length of time The Artist's movement slows when Dire Crows take flight by 0.5 seconds.

Garden of Rot.description:
A nude self-portrait in which Carmina depicts a rotting darkness growing outwards from within.

When a Survivor affected by Dire Crows completes the repel action, they are afflicted by the Exposed status effect for 4 seconds.

Exposed Survivors are downed by basic attacks, even if uninjured.

Ink Egg.description:
An unusual egg that seems to be nothing but a ball of semi-solid ink.

Increases the maximum capacity of Dire Crows by 1.Decreases the time Dire Crows stay idle before disintegrating by 4 seconds.

Severed Hands.description:
Carmina's severed hands, cut from her arms shortly before her death. The sight brings sheer fury to her and her protectors.

Any Survivors near a Survivor being swarmed by Dire Crows will also be swarmed.

Iridescent Feather.description:
A glass-like feather molded from The Fog itself. Simple as it may be, it's a symbol of those who watch over Carmina.

The Artist gains the Undetectable status effect when Birds of Torment is in cooldown and she holds no Dire Crows.Decreases the maximum capacity of Dire Crows by 1.

Undetectable hides the Killer's aura, Terror Radius, and Red Stain.

Well Water.description:
Water from the well where Sadako was left to die. Murky and black, it obscures everything around it.

Increases the duration of the Undetectable status effect by 2 seconds when Manifesting by any means.

Undetectable hides the Killer's aura, Terror Radius, and Red Stain.

Bloody Fingernails.description:
Sadako's bloody fingernails, lost as she tried to claw her way out of the well. Evidence of her single-minded need to kill.

Increases the duration of Projection’s bonus movement speed by 50%.

Mother's Comb.description:
The comb Sadako's mother used in the tape. Sadako's psychic abilities are enhanced when she focuses on it.

Reveals the yellow aura of any TV that is turned off by any means.

VCR.description:
The original VCR that played Sadako's tape. It is still warm to the touch.

All TVs play the Projection effects when The Onryō Projects to a TV.

Worry Stone.description:
While the Ottomarians were told to think only positive thoughts, some kept these stones in their pockets to rub when negative thoughts arose.

Reveals the aura of a Survivor for 6 seconds when they lock a locker.

Ottomarian Writing.description:
The words of Otto Stamper were the only words available for his followers to read, decrying malthink and malspeak.

Decreases Teleport cooldown by 4 seconds while not in Nightfall.

Broken Doll.description:
Followers brought their families to live in a utopia. None of them were spared.

Increases the duration of Nightfall by 20 seconds.

War Helmet.description:
While investigating an Overlap in the Alps, she found an abandoned war bunker. She took a helmet from it after the Overlap nearly took her.

Increases Killer Instinct duration by 1.5 seconds during Nightfall.

Destroyed Pillow.description:
While not allowed to sleep, leaders among the Ottomarians tore sleeping supplies to shreds to prevent malthinkers from sneaking off to nap.

Decreases Teleport cooldown by 2.5 seconds during Nightfall.

Tilling Blade.description:
The island was self-sufficient, and followers tilled the tough soil to grow crops during the warm season.

When a Survivor is injured from full health during Nightfall, they are afflicted with the Blindness, Hemorrhage, and Mangled status effects for 60 seconds.

Blindness prevents Survivors from seeing auras.

Hemorrhage regresses healing progress when not healing, and increases blood trails left by injured survivors.

Mangled increases time required to heal by 25% and lasts until fully healed.

Boat Key.description:
Only one boat allowed people on and off the island, and the keys were hidden away to prevent deserters.

Increases Teleport speed by 25% while not in Nightfall.When the generators are powered up, all active locks are instantly broken.

Field Recorder.description:
Haddie documented all of her forays near Overlaps, to prove not only to the world but herself what she saw and felt.

Nightfall is active at the start of the trial.Nightfall is automatically triggered when the last generator is repaired.Any Survivor that comes into contact with a Remnant is afflicted with the Exhausted status effect for 15 seconds.

Exhausted prevents Survivors from activating certain perks.

Lavalier Microphone.description:
She kept a lav mic nearby, allowing her to record her innermost feelings when under great stress.

Survivor auras are revealed for 3 seconds when using the last Teleport token.When entering a locker using Teleport, other lockers within 6 meters of Survivors open and slam their doors.

Sacrificial Knife.description:
When a journalist attempted to warn the Ottomarians of his true task, he slit her throat as a warning to any dissenters.

Exiting a locker during Nightfall blocks all vault locations within 16 meters for 5 seconds.

Iridescent Wooden Plank.description:
Once the journalist’s blood stained the wooden boards of the stage, everything was set into motion for The Dredge’s arrival.

Survivors are afflicted with the Exposed status effect for the last 12 seconds of Nightfall.

Exposed Survivors are downed by basic attacks, even if uninjured.

Wooden Plank.description:
A wooden plank torn from the stage where Otto Stamper sacrificed a meddling journalist.

Increases the amount Nightfall charges when a Survivor is hooked by 25%.

Caffeine Tablets.description:
Stamper’s followers were told not to sleep, or they would bring the wrath of Druanee upon them. Towards the end, he brought in drugs from the mainland.

Auras of locked lockers are visible in yellow while charging The Gloaming and Teleporting.

Mortar and Pestle.description:
Disconnected from the world and modern medicine, Stamper's followers originally had to make do with the flora local to the island.

The Dredge will emerge from its Remnant facing the same direction as when Teleport is activated instead of the direction facing when the Remnant was placed.

Follower's Cowl.description:
They believed the cowls proved their enlightenment, but they merely kept them in darkness.

Teleporting to the Remnant will activate Killer Instinct even when not in Nightfall.

Burnt Letters.description:
Some followers tried to write letters home. Stamper ensured that nobody would have contact with the outside world.

Increases the amount Nightfall charges when injuring a Survivor by 25%.

Air Freshener.description:
After her parents were found, this was in the bag of belongings the police returned. Haddie doesn’t know why she keeps it.

Adds 1 additional Power Token for Teleporting.

Haddie's Calendar.description:
She planned to cross out each day until her parents took her to India, but when tragedy struck, she abandoned her calendar.

Decreases the time to exit a locked locker by 1 second.

Fallen Shingle.description:
After the Ottomarians were subsumed by The Dredge, the mansion fell into disrepair.

Using Reign of Darkness increases Nightfall charge speed by an additional 15% per second.

Malthinker's Skull.description:
Those who brought negativity to the commune would mysteriously disappear from time to time. Their remains were never found… until The Dredge brought them up.

Increases Nightfall charge speed by 66% while any Survivor is injured.

Akito's Crutch.description:
The crutch used by Kazan's son after falling from a tree. Akito's playmate and her family were punished for the boy's injury.

Increases movement speed of Demon Dash by 13%.

Blackened Toenail.description:
Fell off during one of Kazan's hundred winter treks to the temple. Despite his pilgrimage, Akito's leg would never heal.

Increases movement speed while absorbing Blood Orbs by 0.3 m/s.

Bloody Sash.description:
Blood from a boy who called Kazan The Imposter Noble. Kazan hid evidence of the fight from his father, often reveling at the sash in secret.

Increases movement speed while absorbing Blood Orbs by 0.6 m/s.

Child's Wooden Sword.description:
Akito's practice sword. The child had little use for it after his injury.

Increases Blood Orb aura reading range by 3 meters.

Chipped Saihai.description:
A baton that belonged to Renjiro, it was stolen by Kazan upon his departure.

Increases Blood Fury duration by 6 seconds.

Cracked Sakazuki.description:
A cup from Kazan's wedding ceremony, it never made it through the night before being damaged.

Decreases Blood Fury activation time by 0.5 seconds.Decreases Blood Fury cooldown by 0.5 seconds.

Ink Lion.description:
An ink painting that once hung in the Yamaoka estate. Depicts the story of a lion eaten by mice.

Decreases Blood Fury activation time by 0.5 seconds.Decreases Blood Fury cooldown by 0.5 seconds.Decreases Blood Fury consumption when downing a Survivor by 2 seconds.

Kanai-anzen Talisman.description: A trinket given to Kazan at birth, its powers are meant to protect his family from harm.Increases movement speed of Demon Dash by 8%.

Lion Fang.description: A tooth sold from an exotic vendor, it symbolizes power and nobility.Increases Blood Fury duration by 10 seconds.

Paper Lantern.description:
Perhaps a memento of simpler times, before rage fully enveloped him.

Increases Blood Orb absorption speed by 4 m/s.

Polished Maedate.description:
A horned crest Kazan tore from his helmet after being compared to a demon.

Increases Yamaoka's Wrath passive charge rate by 50%.

Renjiro's Bloody Glove.description:
The glove Renjiro held to his sternum following the strike dealt by his son.

All Survivors can see Blood Orbs at the same distance as you.A Survivor's aura is revealed for 3 seconds when coming into contact with a Blood Orb.

Rotting Rope.description:
Had the rope been stronger, it would have likely held Kazan. As it was, he escaped and butchered his captors.

Increases Blood Orb aura reading range by 2 meters.

Scalped Topknot.description:
The topknot of a samurai who questioned Kazan's honor. The roots cling to a thin strip of bloody skin.

Decreases time to activate Demon Dash by 0.5 seconds.

Shattered Wakizashi.description: The fragments of an ancestral blade, destroyed by Kazan in a fit of rage.Increases Yamaoka's Wrath passive charge rate by 100%.

Splintered Hull.description:
Fragments of a ship that carried Renjiro Yamaoka. Against all odds, the legendary samurai seemed to survive.

Increases the frequency of Blood Orbs dropped by Survivors by 33%.Survivors drop an additional Blood Orb when they vault, throw pallets, exit lockers, crouch, or fail a skill check.

Tear Soaked Tenugui.description:
The cloth that Kazan's mother cried into when he left on his pilgrimage to cleanse the samurai.

Decreases Blood Fury consumption when downing a Survivor by 4 seconds.

Wooden Oni Mask.description:
A mask that a young Kazan bought to celebrate Setsubun, its repulsively fanged mouth began haunting his nightmares.

Increases the frequency of Blood Orbs dropped by Survivors by 14%.Survivors drop an additional Blood Orb when they vault, throw pallets, exit lockers, crouch, or fail a skill check.

Iridescent Family Crest.description:
A crest that denotes its owner as being a part of the Yamaoka family.

Miss a charged attack during Blood Fury to smash the ground and create a shock wave. Any Survivors within 24 meters will scream and reveal their current location to you for 4 seconds.

Yamaoka Sashimono.description:
The banner of the Yamaoka family, Kazan felt an overwhelming pride from it.

Increases Blood Fury duration by 8 seconds.

Prayer Rope.description:
Tightly knitted rope used in praying rituals. Can be attached to the Key.

Adds 10 seconds of use to the Key.

Prayer Beads.description:
A chain of matte beads of various sizes used in praying rituals. Can be attached to the Key.

Adds 15 seconds of use to the Key.

Eroded Token.description:
A heavily worn out token made of brass. If an inscription or drawing was once engraved in it, it has today completely disappeared. Can be attached to the Key using its jump ring to channel the Key's aura reading ability.

Reveals Survivor auras when within 24 meters.

Gold Token.description:
A gold token with a dull appearance. Both faces are smooth and void of any inscriptions. Can be attached to the Key using its jump ring to channel the key's aura reading ability.

Reveals Survivor auras when within a 48 meter range.

Blood Amber.description:
A blood-red amber striped with black veins. The amber is warm to the touch. Can be attached to the Key using its jump ring to channel the key's aura reading ability.

Reveals the Killer's aura within a 32 meter range.Increases the Key's energy usage by 100%.

Milky Glass.description:
This opaque piece of glass emits a dull vibrating noise. When the Key is used to unlock the Hatch, the glass token protects the Key from breaking, channeling The Fog's energy into the glass.

Do not lose the Key when unlocking the Hatch, lose this add-on instead.

Weaved Ring.description:
A mundane key ring in appearance with an unusual bluish dark sheen. The ring binds the Key to the user, preventing its loss even in the darkest of times.

Do not lose the Key on death, lose this add-on instead.

Scratched Pearl.description:
A porous and scratched white pearl. A minuscule jump ring allows the pearl to be attached to the Key.

Increases the range of the Key's aura reading ability by 12 meters.

Unique Wedding Ring.description: An engraved wedding ring that emerged from The Fog and resonates with an indescribable and incomprehensible energy. Reveals the Obsession's aura at all times, without the need to channel the Key's energy.Decreases your chances to be The Killer’s Obsession.

Blight Serum.description:
A small amount of Compound Thirty-Four, the final serum The Blight worked on before his transformation. Causes extreme mutations in high doses.

You gain 1 charge of Blighted Rush that replaces your Killer power until consumed. Press the Power button to initiate a Blighted Rush, allowing you to quickly dash forward.You can not attack during a Blighted Rush.You gain 1 additional charge of Blighted Rush every time you hook a Survivor, up to a maximum of 1 charge.This add-on may have unknown effects on certain Killers.Only playable during the Midnight Grove Event.

Ataxic Respiration.description:
The irregular and deteriorating breath collected from the catatonic boy. Normally stable and calm, becomes incredibly agitated at The Nurse's touch.

Decreases base Blink fatigue duration by 12.5%.

\"Bad Man's\" Last Breath.description:
A powerful last breath snatched from Crotus Prenn asylum patient "the Bad Man." In the hands of The Nurse, it jolts with intensity.

Hitting a survivor with a successful Blink attack grants the Nurse Undetectable for 16 seconds. This effect may be only triggered once every 60 seconds.

Undetectable hides the Killer's aura, Terror Radius, and Red Stain.

Dull Bracelet.description:
A worthless piece of jewelry that might have had an important significance to someone. Taken from the anxious girl's body.

Decreases maximum Blink distance by 20%.Increases Bloodpoints for Precise Blink score events by 100%.

Heavy Panting.description:
The slow and bulging breath stolen from the fat orderly. Dimly oscillates at The Nurse's touch.

Increases maximum Blink range by 20%.Increases maximum Blink charge time by 20%.

Jenner's Last Breath.description:
A powerful last breath snatched from Crotus Prenn asylum patient Mary Jenner. In the hands of The Nurse, it trembles with intensity.

After Blinking, allows The Nurse to immediately Blink back to her original position by pressing the Active Ability Button. Must be triggered before The Nurse succumbs to fatigue.

Kavanagh's Last Breath.description:
A powerful last breath snatched from Crotus Prenn asylum orderly Harvey Kavanagh. In the hands of The Nurse, it wobbles with intensity.

Increases maximum Blink range by 30%.Increases maximum Blink charge time by 30%.

Matchbox.description:
A matchbox containing an odd collection of mismatched buttons. Serves as a reminder of a horrible place.

Removes 1 Blink charge.Increases The Nurse's base movement speed to 4.2 m/s.

Spasmodic Breath.description:
The twitchy and tremulous breath stolen from the "Bad Man." Aggressively pulses and jumps at The Nurse's touch.

Hitting a survivor with a successful Blink attack disables the ability to Blink and increases the Nurse's base movement speed to 4.6 m/s for 60 seconds.

Award-Winning Chilli.description:
A big bowl of spicy chili made famous thanks to prime meat.

Increases maximum Chainsaw Sweep duration by 0.5 seconds per charge spent.

The Beast's Marks.description:
Jagged marks cover the Chainsaw's body, punishment from the dark beast that lives in The Fog. Memories of violent reprimands fill its holder with the fear of failure.

Increases Chainsaw Sweep movement speed by 3%.Increases time required to charge the Chainsaw by 14%.

Begrimed Chains.description:
This chain is stained with a foul substance that debilitates anyone it touches.

Chainsaw hits cause Survivors to drop their items.

Carburetor Tuning Guide.description:
A crudely drawn guide to properly adjust and tune a Chainsaw carburetor.

Automatically consume all charges when triggering a Chainsaw Sweep.Increases Chainsaw Sweep duration by 0.5 seconds.Decreases Chainsaw Sweep movement speed by 2%.

Chainsaw File.description:
A file whose purpose is to hone Chainsaw chains.

Decreases tantrum duration by 0.5 seconds.

Chilli.description:
A big bowl of steaming chili to keep you fresh and strong.

Increases maximum Chainsaw Sweep duration by 0.25 seconds per charge spent.

Depth Gauge Rake.description:
Tool that increases the angle of the depth gauge, making the chain eat more "wood".

Grants 1 additional Chainsaw charge.Increases time required to charge the Chainsaw by 22%.Decreases Chainsaw Sweep movement speed by 2%.

Grisly Chains.description:
A chain with unusually hefty cutter teeth that leaves victims crippled even after being healed.

Chainsaw hits inflict Mangled.

Mangled increases time required to heal by 25% and lasts until fully healed.

Homemade Muffler.description:
A makeshift exhaust system made of black gas pipes.

Decreases tantrum duration by 1 second.

Iridescent Flesh.description:
A thin slice of smooth, young flesh. The veins shimmer with luminescent glow, as if life still flows within.

Hitting a Survivor with the Chainsaw replenishes its charges.Limits the maximum tantrum duration to 5 seconds.

Knife Scratches.description:
Scratches cover the Chainsaw's body, caused by a searing blade. Memories of reprimands fill its holder with the fear of failure.

Increases Chainsaw Sweep movement speed by 2%.Increases time required to charge the Chainsaw by 14%.

Light Chassis.description:
A light and durable Chainsaw chassis with a shorter guide bar. Makes the Chainsaw easier to handle.

While revving, see the auras of Survivors within 8 meters.

Long Guide Bar.description:
A sturdy iron replacement bar for long chains.

Increases the time the Chainsaw can be revved before triggering a tantrum by 2 seconds.

Primer Bulb.description:
Pumps more gas in the ignition system to ensure a quick and powerful start.

Decreases time required to replenish a charge by 1 second.

Rusted Chains.description:
This chain is covered with crusty and volatile rust spots that make injuries particularly difficult to heal.

Chainsaw hits inflict Broken for 90 seconds.

Broken prevents Survivors from being healed.

Shop Lubricant.description:
An oil specifically formulated for chainsaws. A special additive prevents oil throw off.

Downing a Survivor with the Chainsaw while no other Survivors are in your Terror Radius will hide the Survivor's aura for 20 seconds.

Spark Plug.description:
A clean spark plug fitted for a Chainsaw.

Decreases time required to replenish a charge by 0.5 seconds.

The Grease.description:
A thick yellowish ooze, concocted by the Sawyers. Used for all-purpose lubrication around their house.

Increases the time the Chainsaw can be revved before triggering a tantrum by 3 seconds.

Vegetable Oil.description:
A rancid oil used as a poor quality lubricant.

Decreases Chainsaw cooldown by 0.3 seconds.

Map Addendum.description:
A fragmented piece of a thick fibrous material. A partial and faded Map is drawn on it which by itself is useless.

Adds a 5 second charge to any Map.

Retardant Jelly.description:
A slimy, translucent substance with a ghastly lavender shade. This jelly from unknown origin is highly resistant to heat.

Slows down the burning rate of the Map by 20%.

Glass Bead.description:
A strange bead circled with gold that can be used to magnify the Map and mark a specific position. The bead emits an energy which can be felt and seen by Survivors.

Unlocks the marker ability on the Secondary Action button.Creates a marker that can be seen by all Survivors.

Crystal Bead.description:
An intricate set of lenses wrapped up in an astonishingly complex apparatus. The gears controlling the lenses' focus move by themselves as to focus on something invisible to humans.

Every Survivor sees the aura generated by the Map when the owner activates it.

Odd Stamp.description:
A stamp carved out of sturdy blonde wood. The text found at the base is incomprehensible: "kw'zvre'od". Can be used with a Map.

Increases the range of the Map tracking ability by 12 meters.

Unusual Stamp.description:
A wooden stamp with a crosshatched rubber pad used to mark documents. It is unclear as to how or by whom this stamp was originally used. Can be used with a Map.

Increases the range of the Map tracking ability by 8 meters.

Black Silk Cord.description:
A smooth black cord with a soft appearance. Can be tied around a Map to enhance its aura reading ability.

Unlocks the ability to track the Hatch.

Red Twine.description:
A bristly and rough piece of twine of a deep red color. Can be tied around a Map to enhance its aura reading ability.

Unlocks the ability to track the Killer's belongings.

Yellow Wire.description:
A small electrical wire. Both ends are heavily damaged like it has been forcefully torn out of its intended location. Can be tied around a Map to enhance its aura reading ability.

Unlocks the ability to track exit gates.

Bandages.description:
A pack of bandages usually found in first aid kits.

Adds 8 charges to the Med-kit.

Gel Dressings.description:
A pack of gel forming pads used to patch up heavily exudating wounds.

Adds 16 charges to the Med-kit.

Medical Scissors.description:
Scissors designed to easily cut through textiles.

Increases healing speed by 15%.

Butterfly Tape.description:
Medical quality tape used to close small wounds.

Increases healing speed by 5%.

Sponge.description:
A mundane sponge used to soak up extra blood, providing easier access to wounds.

Increases progression bonus for succeeding Great Skill Checks by 5%.

Rubber Gloves.description:
Disposable medical gloves to avoid cross-contamination.

Increases progression bonus for succeeding Great Skill Checks by 3%.

Styptic Agent.description:
A white powder with coagulant properties. Apply the agent to a wound to stop it from hemorrhaging.

Press the Secondary Action button while healing with the Med-kit to use the Styptic Agent.When the Styptic Agent is used on an injured Survivor, they gain Endurance for 8 seconds.Consumes the Med-kit on use.

Endurance prevents a Survivor from being downed, inflicting Deep Wound instead.

Deep Wound will put a Survivor in the dying state unless it is mended before the timer runs out.

Anti-Hemorrhagic Syringe.description:
An anti-hemorrhagic substance that stops the bleeding in a matter of seconds.

Press the Secondary Action button while healing with the Med-kit to use the Anti-Hemorrhagic Syringe.The affected Survivor will gain a health state 16 seconds after use.The time required is modified by perks, items and add-ons that affect Healing Speeds.This effect is canceled when the affected Survivor changes health state or is picked up.Consumes the Med-kit on use.

Abdominal Dressing.description:
A highly absorbent pad that prevents bodily fluid leakage when applied to large abdominal wounds.

Increases healing speed by 25%.Decreases Med-kit charges by 8.

Refined Serum.description:
A refined version of the putrid serum that’s mostly safe for human consumption. Mostly.

Press the Secondary Action button while healing with the Med-kit to use the Refined Serum.Increases the speed of the Survivor by 5% for 20 seconds.Creates a blight trail behind the Survivor.Consumes the Med-kit on use.

Gauze Roll.description:
A sterile gauze used for a variety of wounds. Part of a total wound care system.

Adds 12 charges to the Med-kit.

Needle & Thread.description:
Not exactly a medical device, however it can be used to quickly and painfully close up a wound.

Increases the chances of triggering a Skill Check by 10%.100% Bonus Bloodpoints granted for succeeding Great Skill Checks.Increases healing speed by 15%.

Self Adherent Wrap.description:
A pack of bandages that sticks to themselves without the need of clips for a faster patch-up that requires less readjustments.

Adds 8 charges to the Med-kit.Increases healing speed by 5%.

Surgical Suture.description:
A medical device used to close and hold body tissue. Even though it's very effective, the surgical suture is challenging to use.

Increases the chances of triggering a Skill Check by 15%.150% Bonus Bloodpoints granted for succeeding Great Skill Checks.Increases healing speed by 15%.

Bloodied Mud.description:
A handful of mud with veins of deep crimson. The bloody layers empower the mud.

Increases Phantasm Trap trigger range by 30%.

Bloodied Water.description:
Tainted water contained in a folded waterlily leaf.

Increases Phantasm Trap trigger range by 20%.

Bog Water.description:
Murky water contained in a glass pill bottle from another time.

Increases Phantasm Trap trigger range by 10%.

Cracked Turtle Egg.description:
A pale orange turtle egg, cracked and emptied of its content.

Increases triggered Phantasm Trap duration by 35%.

Cypress Necklet.description:
A rigid ornament worn around the neck made from dead plants adorned with crudely attached cypress bark and swamp moss.

Increases Phantasm Trap setting speed by 20%.

Dead Fly Mud.description:
A small lump of mud, black with the remains of flies. Devoured to increase stamina.

Increases teleportation range by 20%.

Disfigured Ear.description:
The cannibal village deaf boy's ear. Deformed due to several hits to the head. The trapped life essence within unlocks tremendous potential in The Hag's power.

Survivors who trigger a Phantasm Trap will be deafened for 6 seconds.

Dragonfly Wings.description:
A handful of yellowish wings, dry and crisp. Devoured to increase stamina.

Increases teleportation range by 25%.

Dried Cicada.description:
A large swamp cicada covered in a fine layer of ash. Crispy. Devoured to increase stamina.

Increases teleportation range by 30%.

Grandma's Heart.description:
The cold heart of the cannibal village elder. The trapped life essence within unlocks tremendous potential in The Hag's power.

Decreases Terror Radius to 0 meters when a Survivor triggers a Phantasm Trap.Increases Mud Phantasms' Terror Radius by 16 meters.

Half Eggshell.description:
One half of a perfectly round hollow eggshell.

Increases triggered Phantasm Trap duration by 30%.

Mint Rag.description:
A small piece of cotton torn from the dress worn by Lisa Sherwood on the day she disappeared. The trapped life essence within unlocks tremendous potential in The Hag's power.

The Hag can teleport to any Phantasm Trap in the level.Phantasm Trap teleport gains a cooldown of 15 seconds.

Powdered Eggshell.description:
Minuscule eggshell fragments shimmering with a pale golden hue.

Increases triggered Phantasm Trap duration by 25%.

Pussy Willow Catkins.description:
A handful of small, pristine flower clusters covered in a fine greyish fur.

Reveals the Survivor's aura for 3 seconds when they trigger a Phantasm Trap.

Rope Necklet.description:
A rigid ornament worn around the neck made from dead plants.

Increases Phantasm Trap setting speed by 15%.

Rusty Shackles.description:
Shackles once used to hold prisoners and carcasses in the cannibal village cellar. The trapped life essence within unlocks tremendous potential in The Hag's power.

Triggered Phantasm Traps give no indication of being triggered to Survivors and do not spawn a Mud Phantasm.

Scarred Hand.description:
