A standing portable vanity mirror which has been violently scratched with a sharp metallic object.

Evil Within I reveals Survivors' auras when stalking within a 32 meter range.Evil Within cannot progress past TIER I.For each Hit score event, score 100% Bloodpoints in the Brutality category and an additional 200% Bloodpoints in the Deviousness category.

Tacky Earrings.description:
A very cheap piece of jewelry made from plastic. Painted to resemble precious material.

Increases movement speed while stalking by 10%.

Tombstone Piece.description:
A fist-sized granite piece taken from a broken tombstone.

Unlocks the ability to kill healthy or injured Survivors with Evil Within III.Killing a Survivor drains the power of Evil Within.Increases the amount of evil required to reach Evil Within III from Evil Within II by 150%.

Vanity Mirror.description:
A standing portable vanity mirror in perfect condition except for a fine layer of dust and face powder covering it.

Evil Within II reveals Survivors' auras when stalking within a 16 meter range.Evil Within cannot progress past TIER II.For each Hit score event, grant 100% Bloodpoints in the Brutality category and an additional 150% Bloodpoints in the Deviousness category.

Rickety Pinwheel.description:
A pinwheel found in the caves of Izu Oshima. It spins even when there is no wind, disorienting those who see or hear it.

While Survivors are within 8 meters of a powered TV, they are afflicted with the Oblivious status effect. This effect lingers for 7 seconds after the TV is turned off.

Oblivious prevents Survivors from hearing or being affected by the Killer's Terror Radius.

Videotape Copy.description:
A copy of the deadly videotape imprinted upon by Sadako. It dampens the desire for vengeance.

Projection does not inflict Condemned to nearby Survivors.Gain 100% bonus Bloodpoints for Deluge of Fear score events.

Old Newspaper.description:
It tells of a local woman who predicted a volcanic eruption, evidence used to initially find Sadako.

Increases the Manifestation invisibility duration by 33%.

Cabin Sign.description:
The cabin where both Tomoko and Reiko watched the tape. Carries the memory of those first curses.

Decreases the time it takes for a TV to turn on after Projection by 12 seconds.

Mother's Mirror.description:
A mirror from Sadako's mother's house. A reminder of what Sadako has lost.

Increases the Manifestation intermittent visibility duration by 2 seconds.

Reiko's Watch.description:
The watch that Reiko left her son Yoichi. A distracting and constant reminder of one’s impending doom.

Increases the invisibility duration while Demanifested by 50%.

Sea-Soaked Cloth.description:
The hood worn by the mysterious figure in the tape. Makes those near it unable to trust what they see.

While Survivors are within 8 meters of a powered TV, they are afflicted with the Blindness status effect. This effect lingers for 7 seconds after the TV is turned off.

Blindness prevents Survivors from seeing auras.

Clump of Hair.description:
Once beautiful and long, Sadako now hides behind her ragged, matted locks.

Decreases the range at which The Onryō is visible while Demanifested by 6 meters.

Well Stone.description:
A piece of the well where Sadako was trapped, an image burned into the mind of all those who have watched the tape.

Decreases the time it takes for a TV to turn on after being turned off by a Survivor by 6 seconds.

Yoichi's Fishing Net.description:
The net Yoichi used while fishing with his grandfather. A reminder that death comes to us all.

Decreases the time it takes for Survivors to gain Condemned by 12% when holding a tape.

Scraps.description:
Springs, screws and gears. Mostly unusable junk.

Adds 8 charges to the Toolbox.

Wire Spool.description:
A portable but heavy spool of copper wire.

Adds 12 charges to the Toolbox.

Clean Rag.description:
A mundane rag. Suspiciously clean.

Increases the Toolbox's repair speed by 20%.

Grip Wrench.description:
An adjustable wrench with a tough grip. Essential in any Toolbox.

Hooks sabotaged using the Toolbox take an extra 15 seconds to respawn.

Hacksaw.description:
A small hand saw mounted with a metal cutting blade.

Increases the Toolbox's sabotage speed by 20%.

Protective Gloves.description:
Thick gloves which reduce manual dexterity but protect hands from injury.

Prevents the Killer from being notified when sabotaging a hook with the Toolbox.

Brand New Part.description:
This intricate mechanical part feels oddly out of place. It is clean and shiny as if straight out of the factory.

Toolbox Repair action is replaced with Install Brand New Part.Installing the Brand New Part will automatically repair 15% of a generator over 5 seconds.During the installation, you will be faced with 2 difficult Skill Checks.Successfully hitting a Skill Check will result in an additional 5% generator repair progress, up to a total of 25% generator repair progress.This add-on is consumed after use.

Instructions.description:
Someone quickly painted what seems to be repair instructions on this piece of bark.

Eliminates Skill Checks while repairing with the Toolbox.

Cutting Wire.description:
A rudimentary cutting tool made from a jagged metal wire and two wooden handles.

Increases the Toolbox's sabotage speed by 15%.

Socket Swivels.description:
Swivels provide bend and flexibility for bolts that are out of reach, deep within mechanical devices.

Increases the Toolbox repair speed by 30%.

Spring Clamp.description:
Useful tool to clamp hoses or hold wires in place and prevent damage or injury.

The distance at which your repairs can be heard is reduced by 8 meters.

Black Strap.description: A nylon strap that was used to restrain a victim to a metal frame. The color makes it difficult to see the blood soaked into it.Increases the range of Punishment of the Damned by 0.5 meters.

Burning Man Painting.description: A diagram of the Lakeview Hotel. Red flames are painted over this place of guilt.Increases the range of Punishment of the Damned by 1.5 meters.

Cinderella Music Box.description: A music box with a figure from the fairy tale Cinderella. Found inside a suitcase adorned with stickers from multiple destinations.Increases the duration of trails left by Rites of Judgment by 15 seconds.

Copper Ring.description: Found in the basement of Brookhaven Hospital. It’s engraved with a picture of a spider.Increases maximum duration of Rites of Judgment by 1 second.

Crimson Ceremony Book.description:
A book about an ancient god. Author unknown.Rites of Judgment trails inflict Hemorrhage until Torment ends.

Hemorrhage regresses healing progress when not healing, and increases blood trails left by injured survivors.

Dead Butterfly.description: A butterfly found on a bed at Wood Side Apartments. It’s frail and nearly falls apart when touched.Decreases time required to recharge Rites of Judgment by 2 seconds.

Forgotten Videotape.description: A videotape of two lovers vacationing in Silent Hill. Despite its sentimental value, it was left behind in the Lakeview Hotel.Decreases time required to recharge Rites of Judgment by 3 seconds.

Iridescent Seal of Metatron.description: A talisman with an odd design inscribed on it. The Entity’s influence seems to have altered it.When sending a Survivor to a Cage of Atonement, the auras of all Survivors suffering from Torment are revealed for 6 seconds.

Lead Ring.description: Found in a refrigerator. It’s engraved with a disgusting, bloated face.Increases the duration of trails left by Rites of Judgment by 10 seconds.

Leopard-Print Fabric.description: A shred of pink, leopard print fabric. It’s difficult to tell what it was used for.Increases the duration of Killer Instinct when triggered by Rites of Judgment by 0.5 seconds.

Lost Memories Book.description:
A book about the history and legends of Silent Hill and the surrounding area.Rites of Judgment trails inflict Oblivious for 15 seconds.

Oblivious prevents Survivors from hearing or being affected by the Killer's Terror Radius.

Mannequin Foot.description: The smooth grey foot of a mannequin, brutally torn from its leg.Increases the duration of trails left by Rites of Judgment by 20 seconds.

Misty Day, Remains of Judgement.description: A painting of an imposing figure wearing a steel pyramid atop his head. Victims are caged in the background.Increases the duration of Killer Instinct when triggered by Rites of Judgment by 1 second.

Obsidian Goblet.description:
An ancient looking goblet carved from pure obsidian.Grants Undetectable while standing on a Rites of Judgment trail.

Undetectable hides the Killer's aura, Terror Radius, and Red Stain.

Rust-colored Egg.description:
An old-looking egg, colored reddish orange. About the size of a quail’s egg.Rites of Judgment trails inflict Blindness for 60 seconds.

Blindness prevents Survivors from seeing auras.

Scarlet Egg.description: A fresh egg, strikingly red in color. About the size of a quail’s egg.Increases the duration of Killer Instinct when triggered by Rites of Judgment by 1.5 seconds.

Spearhead.description: The sharp, rusted tip of a spear. It’s flaked with blood from its last victim.Increases maximum duration of Rites of Judgment by 1.5 seconds.

Tablet of the Oppressor.description: A metal tablet engraved with Aztec figures.Increases maximum duration of Rites of Judgment by 2 seconds.

Valtiel Sect Photograph.description: A photograph of two figures in red hoods. Entitled Crimson and White Banquet for the Gods.Decreases time required to recharge Rites of Judgment by 4 seconds.

Wax Doll.description: A doll carved from wax, handcrafted by a prisoner who would soon face their judgment.Increases the range of Punishment of the Damned by 1 meter.

Bloody Coil.description:
Part sticky, part slippery, this grim liquid makes handling the traps' springs more dangerous.

When a Bear Trap is disarmed by a healthy Survivor, the bloody coils exact their price and that Survivor becomes injured.

Iridescent Stone.description:
Traps sharpened with this sickly gleaming stone seem to gain a life of their own.

Every 30 seconds, one closed Bear Trap chosen at random becomes set.

Oily Coil.description:
An oiled spring that marks the hands of those who meddle with a Bear Trap.

When resetting a Bear Trap, reveal the aura of the most recent Survivor to disarm it for 5 seconds.

Rusted Jaws.description:
These Bear Trap jaws are covered with crusty and volatile rust spots that makes injuries particularly difficult to heal.

Bear Traps inflict Mangled on trapped survivors.

Mangled increases time required to heal by 25% and lasts until fully healed.

Tension Spring.description:
A high tension spring that snaps back into place after being stretched.

A Bear Trap resets 2 seconds after a Survivor escapes from it.

Coffee Grounds.description:
An old rusted can containing damp coffee grounds.

Gain a 5% Haste status effect for 5 seconds after setting a Bear Trap.

Haste increases Killer movement speed.

Bloody Boa.description:
A boa that Ji-Woon draped around a victim’s slashed neck. A number of pockets are concealed within it.

Increases the maximum carried Blades by 8.Start the Trial with 8 additional Blades.

Memento Blades.description:
Blood-rusted knives, worn from overuse. Employed during Ji-Woon's early murders, they hold a place of importance in his heart.

Increases number of Blade hits required for maximum Laceration by 1.Gain 100% bonus Bloodpoints for Showstopper score events.

Trick Pouch.description:
A pouch with a number of hidden pockets. Used by aspiring magicians and those with something to hide.

Increases maximum carried Blades by 4.Start the Trial with 4 additional Blades.

Killing Part Chords.description:
A set of chords that Ji-Woon never found a song for. Still, the sound is undeniably catchy.

Increases movement speed while throwing Blades by 1%.

Inferno Wires.description:
Burnt wires from the studio fire that killed four of the five NO SPIN members. Their deaths gave rise to The Trickster.

Increases duration of Main Event by 25%.

Ji-Woon's Autograph.description:
A signature from the celebrity known as The Trickster. Sore as his wrist was after hundreds of these, it was invigorating to know he was so in demand.

Decreases the number of Blades required to reach maximum throw rate by 1.

On Target Single.description:
An underground single produced by Ji-Woon before achieving fame. Only the biggest NO SPIN fans collected this hidden gem.

Increases time before Laceration starts decaying by 2 seconds.

Lucky Blade.description:
The first throwing knife Ji-Woon ever owned. Purchased by his father, he was expected to put on a show for those frequenting the family restaurant.

Increases the duration of Main Event by 0.2 seconds for each Blade hit while it is active.

Caged Heart Shoes.description:
Shoes that Ji-Woon wore during the music video for One Caged Heart. Allows for smooth, graceful movements of the point dance.

Increases movement speed while throwing Blades by 2.5%.

Tequila Moonrock.description:
A drink invented in a modest Changwon bar. Became a favorite of Ji-Woon's.

Increases duration of Main Event by 50%.

Fizz-Spin Soda.description:
A limited edition can of soda promoting NO SPIN. High sugar and caffeine content.

Decreases the number of Blades required to reach maximum throw rate by 2.

Waiting For You Watch.description:
A pocket watch worn by Ji-Woon during a live performance of I’ll Be Waiting for You. It’s a stage prop that doesn’t work and never will.

Increases the duration of Main Event by 0.3 seconds for each Blade hit while it is active.

Ripper Brace.description:
A wrist brace worn by Ji-Woon during the filming of his music video Ripper. Though unintentional, the design stabilizes the wrist better than many medical braces.

Increases time before Laceration starts decaying by 3 seconds.

Melodious Murder.description:
An audio file of victims’ crisp, clear shrieks. Ji-Woon incorporated the sounds into one of his more popular tracks.

Increases Blade reload speed at lockers by 25%.

Diamond Cufflinks.description:
Cufflinks gouged into the eyes of a sasaeng fan who made the mistake of stalking Ji-Woon. Rubbing off the blood, there’s so much to be seen in the glitter.

Reveals Survivor auras for 6 seconds when their Laceration reaches one Blade hit from maximum.

Edge of Revival Album.description:
The Trickster’s debut album. The coarse and vicious tone was met with a mixed reaction from fans despite critical acclaim.

Blades shatter when hitting the environment, dealing 50% Laceration to nearby Survivors.

Trick Blades.description:
Specialty blades that are only seen as faulty by those who lack imagination. A young Ji-Woon dazzled spectators with the tricks he performed.

Blades ricochet off the environment twice.Ricochet hits grant bonus Bloodpoints.

Cut Thru U Single.description:
The first single released by NO SPIN after Ji-Woon joined their ranks. Scored an all-kill on the Korean charts.

Blades pierce through Survivors.Subsequent Survivors hit by the same Blade receive 50% Laceration.

Death Throes Compilation.description:
A collection of the final sounds from Ji-Woon's victims, adapted to a vinyl record. Terrifying and emotionally raw.

When Main Event ends, The Trickster's Blades are replenished.

Iridescent Photocard.description:
A glass-like photo molded from The Fog itself. Ji-Woon's eyes shimmer holographically on his grinning face.

When a Survivor’s Laceration Meter is two or less Blade hits away from the maximum, they are inflicted with Exposed.

Exposed survivors will be downed by basic attacks even if uninjured.

Original Pain.description:
The first pin pushed into Pinhead’s skull. Such pleasure and pain.

Injured Survivors who break free from a possessed chain suffer from Deep Wound.

Deep Wound will put a Survivor in the dying state unless it is mended before the timer runs out.

Ring Drawing.description:
A drawing of the view from inside the well, as drawn by a young Yoichi. Helping those cursed by the tape can only bring misfortune.

Condemned Survivors spread Condemned to other Survivors who complete a healing action on them.

Distorted Photo.description:
Those who have watched the tape find all photos of them distorted, a reminder of their impending doom.

Survivors that witness Manifestation from within 16 meters scream, revealing their location for 4 seconds.

Telephone.description:
After watching the video, victims receive a phone call. They are frozen in fear as they realize they have seven days to live.

Manifestation afflicts Survivors within 7 meters with the Hindered status effect for 3 seconds.

Hindered reduces Survivor movement speed.

Tape Editing Deck.description:
The editing deck used by Reiko and Ryuji to analyze and copy the tape. Copying and sharing the tape is the only way to survive the curse.

Each Survivor starts the trial with a Tape in their possession, and their target TV is the furthest from their location.

Remote Control.description:
A remote for the VCR at the cabin. It allows Sadako to focus on those enemies at a distance.

After using Projection, reveal the auras of Survivors carrying a Tape within 16 meters of any TV for 7 seconds.

Iridescent Videotape.description:
The original tape containing Sadako’s curse.

Hitting a Survivor within 8 seconds after Manifesting turns on the last 4 TVs turned off by Projection.
